protocol_overview.name: x402
protocol_overview.description: An open-source payment protocol that revives the HTTP 402 'Payment Required' status code to enable instant stablecoin micropayments directly over HTTP. Enables AI agents, APIs, and applications to transact autonomously without accounts or manual intervention.

components.name: Client
components.description: AI agents, browsers, or applications making HTTP requests

components.name: Resource Server
components.description: HTTP server providing APIs or content, responds with 402

components.name: Blockchain Settlement Layer
components.description: On-chain settlement via stablecoins (default: USDC on Base)

payment_flow.action: Sends HTTP request to resource server
Responds with HTTP 402 + payment instructions (amount, token, recipient, network)
Constructs signed payment transaction in specified stablecoin
Resends request with X-PAYMENT header containing signed transaction
Verifies payment on-chain, responds with HTTP 200 OK + X-PAYMENT-RESPONSE header

blockchain_support.notes: Designed to be chain-agnostic and eventually payment-rail agnostic

v2_improvements.description: Better distinction between payment logic and application logic
Improved extensibility for new payment schemes and chains without breaking changes
Resolves browser compatibility issues from V1
AI agents auto-discover x402-enabled services without manual endpoint lists
Supports complex access control beyond simple payment gating
Improved compatibility across diverse blockchains and payment networks

inflectiv_relevance.notes: x402 is a natural payment rail for the Inflectiv $INAI economy. x402 micro-payments could power dataset access on the Inflectiv marketplace — agents pay per query using stablecoins, with $INAI as the native token. The Query-Before-Browse pattern in Inflectiv Agent Node maps directly onto x402's request-pay-receive flow.
inflectiv_relevance.integration_opportunity: Replace $INAI internal billing with x402 on-chain micropayments for dataset access, enabling permissionless monetization without a centralized billing system.
